## Function Overview
 
This function is used to obtain the Ethernet priority mark that will be used for outgoing RTP packets.

## Detailed Description

The following code sample shows you how to use the `voice_hal_getRtpEthernetPriorityMark` function:
```c
int32_t priority;
voice_hal_getRtpEthernetPriorityMark(service, profile, &priority);
```
## Key Parameters

`service` - The voice service affected
`profile` - The voice profile affected
`priority` - The Ethernet priority mark to be used for outgoing RTP packets

## Return Values

The function returns RDK_SUCCESS if successful, or RDK_FAILURE if any error is detected.

## Interaction with Other Components

This function interacts with the following components:

RTP Stack

Ethernet Driver

## RDK-Related Operations

This function is part of the RDK Voice HAL API.
